Financial Performance (Q4 FY25)

Balkrishna Industries announced its Q4 FY25 results, revealing a 25% year-on-year drop in net profit. The profit after tax (PAT) for the quarter stood at ₹362 crore.

Despite the decline in net profit, the company's revenue from operations saw a 5% year-on-year increase, reaching ₹2,838 crore.

Earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization (EBITDA) edged up by 1% to ₹703 crore. However, the EBITDA margin contracted by 115 basis points year-on-year, settling at 24.78%.

For the entire fiscal year 2025, the company reported a 13% year-on-year increase in net profit, totaling ₹1,628 crore. Revenue from operations for FY25 rose by 13% year-on-year to ₹10,615 crore.

Balkrishna Industries announced its foray into the passenger car and truck tire segments. The company plans to invest ₹3,500 crore over the next five years to facilitate this expansion.

This strategic shift, combined with the Q4 results, has sparked investor concerns, particularly regarding potential margin pressure and execution risks.

Following the Q4 results and expansion announcement on May 26, 2025, Balkrishna Industries' share price experienced a decline.

Dividend Announcement

The board of directors declared a final dividend of ₹4 per equity share for the fiscal year.

Q1 FY26 Results (Announced later)

In its Q1 FY26 results (announced on August 14, 2025), Balkrishna Industries reported a total income of ₹2867.16 crore, a slight increase of 0.5% compared to the previous quarter (Q4 FY25).

However, profit before tax (PBT) saw a significant decline of 39.0% from the previous quarter, standing at ₹394.38 crore.

Profit after tax (PAT) for Q1 FY26 was ₹288.30 crore, down 40.8% from the previous quarter.
